title: Logbook #3: Antoine Patraldo and the Persistence of Bits
author: Pinche Poutine
excerpt: A collaboration with illustrator Antoine Patraldo, managed through Bash, Vim, and FFMPEGâ€”no GUI required.

sections.title: The Mayfly Artist
sections.content: My latest project, [antoine.patraldo.com](https://antoine.patraldo.com), is a collaboration between an illustrator and a fanatic of his art (myself). Antoine started strong, like a "mayfly": three years of intense production after a late start in life, only to seemingly move on to less interesting pursuits. While I hope my stories and screenplays motivate him to return, the truth is he's already generated enough creative fuel to last me forever.

sections.title: Workflow: Less Mouse, More Bash
sections.content: While he takes a break, I find refuge in the logic of the command line. My Linux setup is an exercise in forced minimalism: **Bash + Vim + FFMPEG**. I do everything I can to avoid the mouse; there's something about the CLI that feels more honest, more direct.

sections.title: The Video Challenge
sections.content: Managing video and audio for these stories without a GUI is a hurdle. Most would say a video editor with buttons and timelines is essential, but I'm sticking with **FFMPEG** commands. The learning curve is steep, but once you master the script, the automation is unbeatable. It's my way of bringing structure to Antoine's artistic chaos.
